subtitleNullable: This dataset contains some food recipes from different categories.
descriptionNullable:
### Context
This dataset contains a total `~3k` different recipes from all recipes categories.

### Content
There are 5 different recipes categories and each category has it's own file `.json` file. These categories are:

* recipes (general recipes) -> `recipes.json`
* inspiration -> `inspiration.json`
* baking -> `baking.json`
* health -> `health.json`
* budget -> `budget.json`


Each `.json` document from these categories contains the following fields:

* `id`:  type of `string` which is the recipe id
* `url`: the url to the recipe website
* `name`: the name of the recipe
* `author`: the author of the recipe
* `rattings`: type of `number` which is the rating of the recipe between `0` and `5`.
* `description`: the recipe description
* `ingredients`: `array` of ingredients used
* `steps`: steps to follow when preparing this recipe
* `nutrients`: an `object` containing the nutrients in this recipe
* `times: an `object` containing preparation and cooking time
* `serves`: type of `number` showing how many people does this recipe serves
* `difficult`: is the recipe easy or difficult to prepare
* `vote_count` : `number` telling us how many people voted for this recipe as good.
* `subcategory`: a `string` telling us the subcategory of the recipe eg. "Bread"
* `dish_type`: a `string` telling us the dish_type of the recipe eg. "Bread roll recipes"
* `maincategory`: the category of the recipe eg. "baking"

### Dataset Usage
* This dataset is flexible you can use it in any way, one of the task is to create a recipe recommendation system for each category using neural networks.
* You can use this dataset to cook

### Acknowledgements
* The data is for research purposes only and belongs to [www.bbcgoodfood.com](https://www.bbcgoodfood.com).
* The data has been collected with the help of [these notebooks](https://github.com/CrispenGari/web-scrapping-python/tree/main/bs4/00_RECIPES)
